snippet: The 17-year-old Utah soccer goalie accused of punching a referee who later died was charged on Wednesday and could face five years in prison if convicted.
abstract: Teenaged Utah soccer player accused of punching referee Ricardo Portillo, who later died, is charged with homicide by assault, which carries a penalty of up to five years in prison if he is convicted; other soccer news noted.
lead_paragraph: The 17-year-old Utah soccer goalie accused of punching a referee who later died was charged on Wednesday and could face five years in prison if convicted.

headline.seo: Teenager Charged With Homicide by Assault in Referee’s Death
headline.main: Teenager Charged With Homicide by Assault in Referee’s Death
